vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἀπ-ᾰλείφω,
perfect ἀπαλήλιφα[Refs 4th c.BC+]:—wipe off, expunge, especially from a record or register, [Refs]; ἀ. τι τῶν δεδογμένων cancel it, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; ἀ. ἀπὸ τῶν παρακαταθηκῶν embezzle part of the deposits, [Refs 4th c.BC+]:—middle, erase, [Refs 5th c.BC+]:—passive, to be erased, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__2 metaphorically, μυρίας ἐπιστολὰς ἓν δάκρυον ἀπαλείφει μητρός[Refs 1st c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: to wipe away; wipe off; wipe out
vocabInfos.mediumDef: to wipe away; wipe off; wipe out
